tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Science and the Shuttle
programme.desc: For more than 25 years the shuttle was our ticket to space, and our laboratory in orbit. Uncover the legacy of this amazing machine, and see what lies ahead.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landing on Mars
programme.desc: Mars sparks our curiosity like no other planet because it is so reachable. Despite having landed there, most of the information we gather is still done by instruments in the planet's orbit.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Rainbow
programme.desc: In the world of astronomy, how do we overcome the limits imposed by our own eyesight? The universe comes alive by viewing the cosmos in infrared light to gamma radiation.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one Earth's closest neighbors, but for centuries it eluded astronomer's best efforts to learn its secrets. But that has changed thanks to missions like Mariner and most recently, Messenger.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Utah Fireball
programme.desc: When hundreds of people see a nighttime fireball over Salt Lake City, Steve and Geoff race to Utah. After searching and communicating with radar expert Rob Matson, they conclude any surviving meteorites must have landed on military property.

programme.title: Meteorite Men: Wisconsin Fireball
programme.desc: The guys are on their way to the Northeast Astronomy Forum in New York for a personal appearance, when a large fireball is seen over rural Wisconsin. Geoff continues on to NEAF to hold down the fort, while Steve begins an all-night drive to the fall site.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The latest updates on the new space hardware about to launch us into the next generation of space flight some rockets and capsules are on time others not so fortunate.

programme.title: The New Frontier: INCREASING ORBIT
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R

programme.title: The New Frontier: Return To The Moon
programme.desc: The Moon, our closest celestial companion. Our indispensible dance partner through the cosmos.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Exo Planeta
programme.desc: As scientists and astronomers peer closer at nearby stars with ever more fidelity they are discovering planets; exo planets, worlds outside our own solar system.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Invasion on Mars
programme.desc: The EXO Mars and Curiosity continue their scientific discoveries as we prepare new missions both robotic and manned to the Red planet Mars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Hyabusa
programme.desc: The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample.

programme.title: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.

programme.title: The New Frontier: PEERING INTO THE ABYSS
programme.desc: Imaging a black hole was a breakthrough in astronomy, now with the new satellite IXPE high energy telescope we will be looking at some of the most dramatic, and most violent objects in the universe: Colliding Black holes and Neutron Stars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Edge of The Universe
programme.desc: The night sky is a time machine. The further we look out into the universe the further back in time we reach.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Gravity
programme.desc: LISA pathfinder, has led the way for a space based gravity wave detector, what are gravity waves and why are they so hard to detect?

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Space Shuttle Matures - The Space Transportation System changes the nature of orbital missions. Complex Construction in Space - Confidence in the shuttle begins to return and engineers for get the lessons of the past.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Shuttle Program - The first re-useable spacecraft. The Challenger Disaster - Pressing launch schedules lead to carelessness and the loss of the Challenger. Return to Space - A re-designed shuttle is back in space with a redefined role.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Begins - The start of NASA & America's first manned space program. Mars Express - The European Space Agency's Mars Satellite. The Soyuz Launch System - The gradual evolution of Russia's Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: The Apollo Program Begins - At the very beginning of NASA's moon project things go wrong. Caves - ESA's special training program for astronauts. Planck - Mapping the cosmic microwave background radiation.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Commences - Did Gemini give the US a lead in the space race? Venus Express - The last days of ESA's Venus probe. EMU - NASA's Extravehicular Mobility Unit. Deep Space Communications - ESA's worldwide network of giant dishes.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Advances - America's first manned space program finally puts a man in orbit. Camera Tracking - The array of special cameras that follow a spacecraft at launch. The International Space Station - The building and operation.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: To the Moon - The Apollo program achieves its major objective. Dragon, Falcon and Spacex - New directions in re-usable spacecraft. Gaia- Mapping our galaxy in unprecedented detail.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Rebuilding Project Apollo - After the Apollo 1 disaster NASA resumes manned space flight. Orbiting Carbon Observatory 2 - Monitoring the Earth's Co2 levels in unprecedented detail. Zero Gravity Training - Parabolic flights.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Beyond Earth Orbit - The Apollo program takes bold new steps. IXV Re-entry Vehicle - Europe is working to perfect a re-entry vehicle. Galileo Satellites Lost and Found - Navigation satellites go into incorrect orbit.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Gemini Advances - NASA refines the techniques needed for rendezvous. Cassini at Saturn - In the Cassini probe's final years of activity, its handlers are asking it to do more complex and risky assignments.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The latest updates on the new space hardware about to launch us into the next generation of space flight some rockets and capsules are on time others not so fortunate.

programme.title: The New Frontier: INCREASING ORBIT
programme.desc: The ISS is the workhorse of the international spacefaring community, but its days are numbered. R

programme.title: The New Frontier: Return To The Moon
programme.desc: The Moon, our closest celestial companion. Our indispensible dance partner through the cosmos.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Exo Planeta
programme.desc: As scientists and astronomers peer closer at nearby stars with ever more fidelity they are discovering planets; exo planets, worlds outside our own solar system.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Invasion on Mars
programme.desc: The EXO Mars and Curiosity continue their scientific discoveries as we prepare new missions both robotic and manned to the Red planet Mars.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Hyabusa
programme.desc: The Japanese Asteroid sample return mission has reached its target and is surveying the space rock ready to dip down and take a sample.

programme.title: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.
